Class SvtDigitizationWithPulserDataMergingReadoutDriver

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lcsim.util.Driver
      • org.hps.readout.ReadoutDriver

  • public class SvtDigitizationWithPulserDataMergingReadoutDriver
extends ReadoutDriver
    SVT readout simulation.
    Author:
    Sho Uemura

    • Constructor Detail

      • SvtDigitizationWithPulserDataMergingReadoutDriver

        public SvtDigitizationWithPulserDataMergingReadoutDriver()

    • Method Detail

      • setAddNoise

        public void setAddNoise(boolean addNoise)
        Indicates whether or not noise should be simulated when analog hits are generated.
        Parameters:
        addNoise - - true adds noise simulation to analog hits, while false uses only contributions from pulses generated from truth data.

      • setEnablePileupCut

        public void setEnablePileupCut(boolean enablePileupCut)
        Indicates whether hits consistent with pile-up effects should be dropped or not. A hit is considered to be consistent with pile-up effects if its earlier sample indices are larger than the later ones, suggesting that it includes the trailing end of another pulse from earlier in time.
        Parameters:
        enablePileupCut - - true enables the cut and drops pile-up hits, while false disables the cut and retains them.

      • setEnableThresholdCut

        public void setEnableThresholdCut(boolean enableThresholdCut)
        Indicates whether noisy analog hits should be retained in readout. Hits are required to have a certain number of samples that exceeds a programmable noise threshold. The required number of samples may be set by the method setSamplesAboveThreshold(int) and the noise threshold may be set with the method setNoiseThreshold(double).
        Parameters:
        enableThresholdCut - - true enables the cut and drops noisy hits, while false disables the cut and retains them.

      • setNoiseThreshold

        public void setNoiseThreshold(double noiseThreshold)
        Sets the noise threshold used in conjunction with the sample threshold cut. The cut is enabled or disabled via the method setEnableThresholdCut(boolean).
        Parameters:
        noiseThreshold - - The noise threshold.

      • setSamplesAboveThreshold

        public void setSamplesAboveThreshold(int samplesAboveThreshold)
        Sets the number of smaples that must be above the noise threshold as employed by the sample threshold cut. The cut is enabled or disabled via the method setEnableThresholdCut(boolean).
        Parameters:
        samplesAboveThreshold - - The number of samples. Only six samples are used, so values above six will result in every hit being rejected. Values of zero or lower will result in the acceptance of every hit. Threshold cut is inclusive.

      • setNoPileup

        public void setNoPileup(boolean noPileup)
        Indicates whether pile-up should be simulated. If set to false, analog hits are generated from the truth hits of a given event individually, with no contribution from neighboring events included. If set to true, data from multiple events is included.
        Parameters:
        noPileup - - true uses data from neighboring events when generating analog hits, while false uses only contributions from a single event.

      • setDropBadChannels

        public void setDropBadChannels(boolean dropBadChannels)
        Specifies whether analog hits which occur on "bad" channels should be included in readout data or not.
        Parameters:
        dropBadChannels - - true means that "bad" channel hits will be excluded from readout, while false means that they will be retained.

      • setReadoutLatency

        public void setReadoutLatency(double readoutLatency)
        Set the readout latency. This does not directly correspond to any internal function in the readout simulation, but affects what range of SVT ADC values are output around the trigger. It is retained to allow a matching to the hardware function.
        Parameters:
        readoutLatency - - The readout latency to use.

      • setUseTimingConditions

        public void setUseTimingConditions(boolean useTimingConditions)
        Sets whether to use manually defined timing conditions, or if they should be loaded from the conditions database.
        Parameters:
        useTimingConditions - - true uses the values from the database, and false the manually defined values.

      • setPulseShape

        public void setPulseShape(String pulseShape)
        Sets the pulse shape to be used when emulating the analog hit response. Valid options are CRRC and FourPole.
        Parameters:
        pulseShape - - The pulse shape to be used.

      • setPulserDataCollectionName

        public void setPulserDataCollectionName(String collection)
        Sets the name of the input pulser data collection name.
        Parameters:
        collection - - The collection name.

      • detectorChanged

        public void detectorChanged(Detector detector)
        Overrides:
        detectorChanged in class Driver

        Overrides:

      • doSiSimulation

        private List<SvtDigitizationWithPulserDataMergingReadoutDriver.StripHit> doSiSimulation()
        Performs a simulation of silicon sensor response and generates a collection of StripHit objects representing the detector response.
        Returns:
        Returns a collection of StripHit objects describing the detector response for the current event.

      • makePulserStripHits

        private List<SvtDigitizationWithPulserDataMergingReadoutDriver.StripHit> makePulserStripHits(Collection<RawTrackerHit> rawHits)

      • addNoise

        private void addNoise(SiSensor sensor,
                      int channel,
                      double[] signal)
        Adds a random Gaussian noise signature to the specified signal buffer based on the sensor and channel parameters.
        Parameters:
        sensor - - The sensor on which the signal buffer occurs.
        channel - - The channel on which the signal buffer occurs.
        signal - - The signal buffer. This must be an array of size six.

      • readoutCuts

        private boolean readoutCuts(RawTrackerHit hit)
        Performs each of the three readout cuts, if they are enabled. This is the equivalent of calling, as appropriate, the methods samplesAboveThreshold(RawTrackerHit), pileupCut(RawTrackerHit), and badChannelCut(RawTrackerHit).
        Parameters:
        hit - - The analog hit to test.
        Returns:
        Returns true if all enabled cuts are passed, and false otherwise.

      • badChannelCut

        private boolean badChannelCut(RawTrackerHit hit)
        Checks whether an analog hit occurred on a "bad" channel.
        Parameters:
        hit - - The hit to be checked.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the hit did not occur on a bad channel, and false if it did.

      • pileupCut

        private boolean pileupCut(RawTrackerHit hit)
        Attempts to eliminate samples where the pulse starts before the sample array. This is done by requiring the second, third, and fourth samples of the array to be increasing in value with index.
        Parameters:
        hit - - The hit to check.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the no pile-up condition is met and false if it is not.

      • samplesAboveThreshold

        private boolean samplesAboveThreshold(RawTrackerHit hit)
        Attempts to eliminate false hits generated due to noise by requiring that a programmable number of samples exceed a similarly programmable noise threshold.
        Parameters:
        hit - - The hit to be checked.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the noise threshold count cut is met and false if it is not.

      • getOnTriggerData

        protected Collection<TriggeredLCIOData<?>> getOnTriggerData(double triggerTime)
        Description copied from class: ReadoutDriver
        Generates a Collection containing any special output data produced by the driver that should be included in triggered output.

        By default, this outputs null. Individual drivers must override the method as needed.
        Overrides:
        getOnTriggerData in class ReadoutDriver
        Parameters:
        triggerTime - - The time at which the trigger occurred.
        Returns:
        Returns a collection containing all special output data.

      • getTimeDisplacement

        protected double getTimeDisplacement()
        Description copied from class: ReadoutDriver
        Specifies the amount of simulation time that the driver needs to produce its output. This indicates that the driver's present output was generated based on input a time equal to (getCurrentTime() - getTimeDisplacement()).
        Specified by:
        getTimeDisplacement in class ReadoutDriver
        Returns:
        Returns the time displacement of output data as a double.

      • getTimeNeededForLocalOutput

        protected double getTimeNeededForLocalOutput()
        Description copied from class: ReadoutDriver
        Specifies the amount of simulation time that the driver needs to produce special on-trigger data.
        Specified by:
        getTimeNeededForLocalOutput in class ReadoutDriver
        Returns:
        Returns the time displacement of output data as a double.
